I believe it was just yesterday that the head of the NAACP in Atlanta held a press conference, during which he strongly condemned those who have judged Michael Vick regarding his alleged involvement in dogfighting and animal cruelty. While I agree with him, to the point that we have not heard all the facts as of yet, I could not help but recall the reaction of the Black community when the ALLEGATIONS that those evil white boys from Duke had raped an innocent and pure Black woman. We all know that the Black community practically had them lynched from day one. Honestly, can anyone REALLY look in the mirror and justify this blatant hypocrisy?
No one has ever claimed the NAACP is a non-biased, non-racist , non-hypocrisy organization.
This is true...I probably should've clarified. You are much too reasonable, I was hoping someone who actually supports the NAACP would chime in and open my terribly closed mind

I think the NAACP has done good things. However, I am appalled that they supported Vick when he used black culture as an excuse for dogfighting. Do they realize what kind of statement that makes for the agency as well as about black culture?
What it demonstrates is that pushing the NAACP's agenda is far more important than doing the right thing. It always has been, nothing new there. emoticon_rolleyes

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Blatant Hypocrisy?
